metadata.title: CVE-2019-1549 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: OpenSSL 1.1.1 introduced a rewritten random number generator (RNG). This was intended to include protection in the event of a fork() system call in order to ensure that the parent and child processes did not share the same RNG state. However this protection was not being used in the default case. A partial mitigation for this issue is that the output from a high precision timer is mixed into the RNG state so the likelihood of a parent and child process sharing state is significantly reduced. If an application already calls OPENSSL_init_crypto() explicitly using OPENSSL_INIT_ATFORK then this problem does not occur at all. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1d (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1c).

criterions.comment: edk2 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0~20191122.bd85bf54-2').
openssl package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1d-2ubuntu1').
